message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV

The paper proposes a method for solving a challenging problem in reinforcement learning, which involves learning an optimal policy from a multi-modal reward function. The proposed method is based on hierarchical reinforcement learning (HRL) and uses density estimation with return-weighted importance sampling to efficiently identify the modes of the reward function. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.RO (Robotics). The paper also presents experiments on a motion planning problem of a redundant robotic manipulator, which suggests that it could also be relevant to cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.CV (Computer Vision).
